Senior Planner

Company Name John Holland Company Location Melbourne

New Posted Date Posted 21 hours ago Number of views 29 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

From humble beginnings almost 70 years ago, John Holland has been driving positive change in Australia, and is now one of the nation’s leading infrastructure and property companies.

We work in Australia, New Zealand and South East Asia offering services from infrastructure and property development, to rail and building.
\xa0

By finding solutions to complex challenges, we transform communities to make them easier to move around, more connected and better to live in.


This is an excellent opportunity for a Senior Planner to join the John Holland national Building Group focusing on a large scale land mark project. The
primary purpose of this role is to establish and manage the process of planning, creating detail programmes, and monitoring performance to deliver
the best quality projects on time and budget.
\xa0

\xa0

Responsibilities of the role include:

  • Implement planning strategies and audits / reviews for projects

  • Ensure project planning activities are conducted in accordance with JH polocies.

  • Supervise staff undertaking planning & controls activities, exercising funcitonal control over all onsite
    staff with planning / scheduling responsibilies.

  • Advise Project Managers in report interpretation, analysis of project performance,
    forward planning and development of corrective actions.
    \xa0

To be successful in this key role, you must have:

  • Qualification in Building, Construction Management or Engineering

  • Minimum 3yrs in a similar role.

  • Strong experience demonstated across large and complex building
    projects.


John Holland is up for the challenge of transforming lives.
\xa0

From Parliament House to the Alice to Darwin Rail Link, from the MCG’s Great Southern Stand to Sydney Metro, we’ve had a hand in the Australia we all know today. We are currently involved in delivering all of Australia’s largest infrastructure projects. Whatever we face, the heart of what we do is creating people-centred solutions to complex challenges and opportunities. We think deeply about what we do and how it affects communities. We push boundaries and innovate, gain trust through our actions and whatever the project, we’re in it for the long, long term.
\xa0

We work hard to attract and retain the best employees, and we provide opportunities for rich career experiences, and a strong framework for on-going career development.
\xa0

We are committed to building, valuing and promoting diversity and inclusiveness across John Holland.

Desired Skills and Experience

As above.

[

Document Support Team Leader

Company Name Hall & Wilcox Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 20 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Hall & Wilcox

Hall & Wilcox is a pre-eminent independent business law firm with one of the fastest growing partnerships in Australia. We are currently a firm of more than\xa0600 people, including 78 partners. We have offices in Melbourne, Sydney, Newcastle, Canberra, Perth and Brisbane and act nationally for Australian-based clients and multinational clients with Australian interests. Our leadership team was recognised by winning Managing Partner of the Year at the 2015 and 2017 Australian Law Awards.

About the role\xa0and team

We have an opportunity for a Document Support Team leader to join our Document Support team of six. Reporting to the Melbourne Office Manager, this role is responsible for ensuring the day to day operational functions of Document Support are running smoothly.

The Team Leader will provide leadership, development and support to the Document Support team to deliver a consistently high word processing service standard to our internal clients.

Duties

This position is responsible for:

  • Supervise and support the national Document Support team
  • Coordinate workflow and delegate tasks
  • Manage outsourcing requirements
  • Act as the contact point for the Document Support function across the firm, including liaising with internal clients and negotiating deadlines
  • Review and develop more efficient document support processes and procedures
  • Document Support work including; digital transcripts, copy typing, document comparisons, converting PDFs, manual editing and troubleshooting documents
  • Manage team rosters, including coordination of team leave

Skills\xa0and experience

  • Experience managing Document Support Operators
  • A minimum typing speed of 80+WPM
  • Minimum five years’ experience as a Word Processing Operator
  • Knowledge of legal and court documents
  • Strong attention to detail and excellent communication skills
  • Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office suite

Culture

At Hall & Wilcox, we practise Smarter Law. This means being smarter across our entire business – by being progressive, by our commitment to excellence and by our focus on building great relationships.

We have a strong values-driven culture - our clients and people choose to work with us because of it. We care about our clients, our community and each other. Whether it be our technology or our business focused approach to the practise of law, we strive to change the legal market for the better. We work hard but we also have fun.

Benefits

  • Modern, open plan offices.
  • Dress for your day – we trust our people to choose clothes that best represent themselves and our brand, every day of the week.
  • Structured learning & development programs for all career levels.
  • Extensive health & wellbeing program including healthy start breakfast program, mindfulness training subsidised fitness, team sports and health checks.
  • Flexible working opportunities – talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you.
  • Salary continuance insurance.

How to apply

To apply for this position please click the apply button above. For more information please contact Lauren Parrant, People & Culture Advisor on 03 9603 3669.

Recruiters please note:

Applications from Recruitment Agencies not briefed will not be accepted for this advertised position. For further information about Hall & Wilcox please visit our website.

\xa0

Associate

  • Law Practice

Full-time

Senior Account Executive

Company Name Auror Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 20 hours ago Number of views 41 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

As the Senior Account Executive you will be responsible for driving new business growth across Australia, along with managing complex sales cycles and presenting, to C-level executives, the value of Auror.\xa0


You’ll have finely tuned analytical skills and the ability to develop clear and agreed upon plans with current and future prospects is incredibly important. Follow through is important to you and you pride yourself on the relationships you build throughout the sales process.
You have a good ability to understand where things are sitting with prospects/customers throughout the sales process and can accurately forecast sales activity to overachievement assigned revenue quota.


You will be responsible for:


  • Identifying potential customers and set approach strategies
  • Developing strong and long-term client relationships
  • Selling across Executive level and across different LOB decision makers that include IT, HR, Marketing, Engineering etc.)
  • Clearly articulating and demonstrating the value of Auror to qualified prospects and working on a mutual plan to bring them to closed-won
  • Expanding relationships with current enterprise clients, while leveraging your business knowledge, to expand and even upgrade the Auror offering throughout their organization(s).
  • Achieving quota and driving performance to exceed quota
  • Maintaining a healthy pipeline within Hubspot with good history of account activity and contact engagement.
  • Presenting to potential prospects, customers, and strategic partners on the value of Auror
  • Developing detailed sales analysis and plan for each deal in your pipeline & effectively sharing progress reports back to Auror


REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years of quota carrying enterprise sales experience to large, complex organizations
  • Track record of over achieving quota in past positions
  • Strong strategic presentation skills
  • Possess a hungry, motivated, high energy, and enthusiastic spirit
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and active listening skills
  • Willingness to travel for regular customer meetings and events
  • Network effectively with local clients and develop strong professional relationships
  • Business acumen with a problem-solving attitude
  • Ability to collaborate & resourceful
  • Strong understanding of sales fundamentals & drive for results
  • Ability to work in fast-paced, team environment
  • Strong analytical and negotiation skills
  • Challenger selling experience

Job description

The Civic Group brings together some of Australia’s most respected and experienced communications, media and political experts. We are industry leaders in designing and implementing strategies that influence and activate public opinion, policy makers and stakeholders. We design and implement strategies that bring together the most effective mix of tactics to meet our clients’ objectives.


We have an immediate opening for a communications professional with strong planning and development experience to join our growing team.


As an Account Executive, the successful candidate will play an important role in managing key client relationships, assisting with the development and execution of communications strategies, building and maintaining relationships with key media, thinking strategically and creatively on behalf of clients and supporting new business initiatives.


Qualifications
  • Minimum 3 years’ in a communications role (state or local government communications experience would be highly regarded)
  • A working knowledge of planning and property development issues in Victoria
  • Excellent writing and editing skills with experience drafting materials such as media releases, speeches, key lines and narratives, web copy and communications collateral
  • Proven media management skills (both proactive and reactive)
  • A demonstrated understanding of State and/or Local Government policy process
  • Strong client relationship management, stakeholder management and interpersonal skills \xa0
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Awareness of public affairs and government issues in Victoria and nationally
  • Hold a relevant degree
  • Must have the ability to work autonomously.


At The Civic Group, we pride ourselves on a real sense of teamwork. This role would suit an energetic and resourceful individual with proven public affairs experience, excellent time-management skills and the ability to analyse and distil complex matters into clear and effective advice.


Please email your CV detailing your qualifications, skills and experience as outlined above to info@thecivicgroup.com.au.

Talent Acquisition Consultant

Company Name North East Link Authority Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 22 hours ago Number of views 41 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Talent Acquisition Consultant


  • Be a part of Victoria’s largest road project by finding talented people to join our growing team
  • Work with a small, busy but passionate team based in the CBD
  • Multiple roles – fixed term

About North East Link Authority

The North East Link Authority will connect the missing link in Melbourne’s freeway network, while increasing the capacity of the Eastern Freeway. It will slash travel times, get trucks off local roads and link key growth areas in the north and south-east.

About the opportunity

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a newly established organisation and directly contribute to our success by finding the best people who share our vision, passion and values.

We will experience significant growth over the next 18 months and looking to fill vacancies across various disciplines including but not limited to: engineering specialists, corporate services, communications and stakeholder engagement.

You will partner with line managers to:

  • understand their vacant role capability and experience requirements
  • provide advice on the most appropriate attraction/sourcing approach
  • ensure a candidate centric approach whilst managing the end to end recruitment process
  • provide advice and coaching to the line manager to ensure the successful candidate has a seamless and welcoming onboarding experience into our organisation.


About you:

You are:

  • passionate about talent acquisition, understanding the business and enjoy developing strong relationships
  • social media and sourcing channel savvy
  • a stickler for detail with strong written communication and organisation skills
  • an individual who thrives working in a fast-paced environment and with a tight knit team


Benefits

Our commitment to creating a workplace that inspires you, engages you and grows you is strong – we want you to be a powerful contributor to this wonderfully diverse and dynamic organisation. Our offering continues to grow but here is what we already have in store for you:

  • Wellbeing program
  • 17.5% leave loading
  • Flexible work arrangements
  • Team benefits discount card at a variety of restaurants and cafes
  • Melbourne CBD location
  • Access to discounted public transport


How to apply

To apply please submit a cover letter and CV at https://jobs.careers.vic.gov.au/jobs/VG-022636.
For a confidential discussion contact Natalie Bellmunt, Manager, People and Culture on 03 9655 6425.
Applications close 11:59pm Thursday 20 September 2018.

Job description

Our preamble:


Annex Media produces engaging and exciting TV Shows for television broadcast to a nationwide audience. At Annex Media, we tell stories about real people and their passions and broadcast these stories on TV. We put a face to the brand and put their stories on TV. Annex Media provides unique opportunities for brands to be on TV.

A great opportunity now exists for a diligent, hard-working, goals-oriented sales representative to join our growing team at our head office in Melbourne CBD. Hourly base wage and uncapped commissions - OTE up to 100k per year.

The position:

We're looking for someone who has a positive and mature outlook, driven by achieving targets and ideally has a background in sales and marketing with a focus on generating new business. Your role will be to research and contact suitable candidates and inspire them to participate in a television programme.

Your duties will include:

  • Making outbound telephone calls
  • Researching suitable participants for an established TV show
  • Scheduling productions on the calendar

  • Improving client experience

  • Not afraid to handle objection
  • The knowledge and experience to pitch high
  • Previous sales experience is a must
  • Thrives in a target driven role
  • IT savvy and must be able to speed type

864744655:
[

Social Worker

Company Name Forensicare Company Location Yarra Bend Road , Fairfield, VIC 3078, AU

New Posted Date Posted 24 hours ago Number of views 30 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Full-time, ongoing
  • Located in Fairfield, 15 minutes from Melbourne’s CBD
  • Free onsite parking

\xa0

Forensicare is the statutory agency responsible for the provision of adult forensic mental health services across Victoria.
Forensicare is situated across five sites across Victoria with its largest site being Thomas Embling Hospital, located in Fairfield just 15 minutes north of the Melbourne CBD.
Thomas Embling Hospital is a 116 bed secure hospital providing acute care, rehabilitation and continuing care services.

\xa0

About the role:

The role of the social worker is to plan, implement and evaluate a high standard of social work service delivery, which privileges the lived experience of consumers and their families and carers. The social worker is an advocate for consumers and carers, assisting them to navigate the multi-layered and complex service systems of which they are a part, applying social work approaches and contributing a unique perspective to the multi-disciplinary team.

\xa0

Duties:

  • Display initiative in social work service delivery.
  • Contribute to person-centred care and treatment, risk assessments and discharge planning.
  • Liaison with external stakeholders, including accommodation placements and NDIS support planning.
  • Promote and develop Aboriginal Service Officer and Cultural Portfolio.

\xa0

Qualification, skills and experience:

  • Approved degree in Social Work and eligibility to join AASW.
  • Demonstrated commitment to mental health consumer recovery.
  • Experience in the mental health field.
  • Demonstrated commitment to advocacy, brokerage and social justice.

\xa0

Benefits:

We value our staff and provide a range of employee benefits including:

  • Great salary packaging conditions
  • Excellent leave entitlements
  • Ongoing training and full orientation
  • Comprehensive Health and Wellbeing Programs including: Staff gym and pool, Staff health service, Critical Incident Stress Management and Employee Assistance Programs.

\xa0

Forensicare values a diverse workforce and strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.


This position is subject to a Police Check.


Forensicare promotes the following values: responsiveness, integrity, impartiality, accountability, respect and leadership; and promotes behaviours that are consistent with these values at all times. Forensicare is an equal opportunity employer and offers a smoke free environment.
